business.headline: Sensex ends 191 points lower, Nifty settles above 23,500; IT stocks tumbleSensex ends 191 points lower, Nifty settles above 23,500; IT stocks tumble

Tracking India's billionaire boom over a decadeIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

entertainment.headline: Aditi Rao's AI-generated 'Bibbo Ghibli Jaan' is the cutest thing on the InternetActor Aditi Rao Hydari joined the growing list of celebrities experimenting with ChatGPT's new AI feature, which transforms images into Ghibli-style versions. She used it to give her Heeramandi character, Bibbojaan, a whimsical makeover, much to the delight of her fans.

Mohanlal plants a kiss on Prithviraj's mother at L2 Empuraan screening. WatchMohanlal recently attended the L2 Empuraan screening in Kerala. A viral video showed the veteran actor planting a kiss on Prithviraj Sukumaran's mother at the event.

Ananya Panday's reaction to 'Mr World Wide' Walker Blanco's post has fans talkingActor Ananya Panday has once again got the internet talking with her comment on rumoured boyfriend Walker Blanco's post. The two have reportedly been dating after Anant Ambani's Jamnagar bash.

Actor Shruti Haasan's Hyderabad live concert postponed. Here's whyActor Shruti Haasan was supposed to perform a live concert in Hyderabad on March 28. However, the event was postponed hours before the scheduled time.

Decoding Akshaye Khanna's secret to staying relevant in BollywoodDespite his absence from the public eye, actor Akshaye Khanna has managed to stay relevant through his iconic film choices and powerful performances. On his 50th birthday today, we take a look at his illustrious filmography and how he has redefined versatility and excellence in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan says 'Hindu-Muslim wasn't the issue' in parents' marriageSalman Khan revealed that the biggest hurdle in his parents' marriage wasn't religion but Salim Khan's career in Bollywood. Salim and Salma Khan got married in 1964.

Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan reacts after alleged casting couch video leakTamil actor Shruthi Narayanan addressed the controversy after her alleged casting couch video surfaced online, urging people not to circulate it further. She described the situation as challenging for her family and herself, appealing for sensitivity and respect

Kartik Aaryan can't take his eyes off 'zindagi' Sreeleela in new picKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela shared a new romantic photo on social media. The image featured the two sitting in what seemed like a tea garden. The photo spoke volumes of their chemistry.

Actor Vikram takes auto to avoid crowd after meeting Sivakarthikeyan at screeningActor Vikram, fondly called Chiyaan by fans, attended the screening of his film, Veera Dheera Sooran's Part 2, in Chennai. After the screening, the actor left for his home in an auto to avoid the crowd at the theatre.

Shivaji Satam on CID's success: We seem like real heroes, we don't fly or jumpShivaji Satam talked about CID's animated version, the show's enduring legacy, and its return to TV. He reflected on its cult status, meme culture, and why it never glorified violence or crime.

Honey Bunny actor reacts after being mistaken for Tamil star Shruthi Narayanan'Citadel: Honey Bunny' actor Shruti Narayann has faced personal and professional challenges due to being mistaken for Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan. The mix-up has led to harassment and work-related setbacks for Narayann.

Neha Kakkar's husband defends her after Melbourne concert backlashSinger Neha Kakkar defended herself after facing backlash in Melbourne, revealing organisers fled with funds. Husband Rohanpreet Singh supported her, urging people not to judge without knowing both sides.

Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri eyes Valentine's Day 2026Kartik Aaryan's upcoming film Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri is scheduled to hit theatres on Valentine's Day 2026. As per reports, Ananya Panday is set to star alongside Aaryan.

Sikandar advance booking: Salman's film beats Kisi Ka Bhai pre-sales before releaseSalman Khan's 'Sikandar' is heading for a good opening day at the box office. The film has grossed decent numbers in its advance booking so far with two more days to go for release.

Pics: Inside Ram Charan's 40th birthday bash hosted by wife Upasana KamineniRam Charan turned 40 years old on March 27. His wife, Upasana Kamineni, hosted a grand birthday bash for him, which was attended by actor Lakshmi Manchu, Mahesh Babu's wife, Namrata Shirodkar, and others.

Raid 2 teaser: It is Ajay Devgn vs Riteish Deshmukh in this gripping dramaAjay Devgn returns as IRS officer Amay Patnaik in Raid 2. The teaser hints at a high-stakes showdown with Riteish Deshmukh's character. Directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, the film releases on May 1.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

Ground Zero teaser: Emraan Hashmi leads a daring mission in intense war dramaEmraan Hashmi stars as BSF officer Narendra Nath Dubey in Ground Zero, inspired by real events. The teaser promises an intense war thriller, backed by Excel Entertainment, and also stars Sai Tamhankar.

Kartik Aaryan, Sreeleela's viral pics, videos from Anurag Basu's film set in SiliguriKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela are currently shooting in Siiguri, West Bengal, for their upcoming untitled film by Anurag Basu. Several pictures of the two from the sets have emerged online.

general news.headline: Huge earthquake hits Myanmar, 2 dead in Bangkok building collapse Live UpdatesMyanmar Earthquake News: Such was the impact of the earthquake that a high-rise collapsed in Bangkok, around 900 km away, killing two labourers and trapping over 40 others.

'Yashu Yashu' pastor Bajinder Singh found guilty in 2018 sexual harassment caseThe self-styled godman was arrested in connection to the same case in July 2018 at the Delhi airport while attempting to board a flight to London.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.

Service charge not mandatory, restaurants can't levy it: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court ruled that service charges on food bills are voluntary and dismissed petitions challenging the CCPA's guidelines prohibiting mandatory imposition by hotels and restaurants.

The lost grave of Dara Shikoh murdered by brother AurangzebMughal emperor Aurangzeb got his brother Dara Shikoh beheaded in Delhi and presented his head to their father, Shah Jahan, whom he had imprisoned in Agra. Experts believe India's history would have been different had a scholarly and secular Dara become the emperor. Amid the controversy over Aurangzeb's grave, a look at the life of Dara, who translated the Upanishads into Persian, and the mystery around his tomb.

Supreme Court's big remark on freedom of speech: Satire enriches lifeThe Supreme Court's remarks came as it quashed an FIR filed against Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi over a poem uploaded by him on social media. It holds importance in the backdrop of the Kunal Kamra row.

Video: Infinity pool turns waterfall as tremors jolt Bangkok after Myanmar quakeA video of the earthquake captured the impact, showing water spilling from rooftop pools of a high-rise building in Bangkok due to the intense shaking.

MP Board Class 5th, 8th Result 2025 Declared: Direct link to check scorecardsThe Rajya Shiksha Kendra (RSK), Madhya Pradesh, has officially declared the MP Board Class 5 and Class 8 final exam results today, March 28, 2025, at 1 pm. Students who appeared for the 2024-25 academic session can now check their results on the official website – rskmp.in.

Cash row: Supreme Court dismisses FIR plea against judge, calls it prematureA huge stash of cash was found from the residence of Justice Yashwant Varma after a fire incident. The Supreme Court said a panel of judges set up by the Chief Justice was probing the matter.

Why thousands of Gazans took to streets against Hamas in rare two-day protestConfronted by the never-ending death and destruction, thousands of Gazans took to the streets against Hamas for two consecutive days. They defied Hamas, a Palestinian terror group, which claims to represent the Gazans. The angry people of Gaza want Hamas to go even as the death toll from the war with Israel crosses 50,000.

Amid AI job threats, Bill Gates lists 3 professions that are safeMicrosoft founder Bill Gates has recently stated that while the AI job threat is real, there are a few careers that will not be affected. In an interview, he highlighted that energy professionals, biologists, and coders will be irreplaceable.

sports.headline: Just want to hit every ball: Ashutosh reveals mantra to power-hittingIPL 2025: Ashutosh Sharma spoke about his power-hitting skills after playing a match-winning knock of 66 for the Delhi Capitals in their match against Lucknow Super Giants.

After the win, Pant quoted a crucial lesson from his mentor MS Dhoni in the post match presentation ceremony.

Pooran, Shardul star as LSG kill SRH-hype, conquer Hyderabad fortressNicholas Pooran continued his big-hitting barrage in LSG's second match of the season. Pooran and Shardul Thakur starred for Lucknow as the visitors drubbed SRH in a powerful display in Hyderabad.

Candace Parker's No. 3 jersey to be retired by Sparks on June 29The Los Angeles Sparks will honor Candace Parker's legendary career by retiring her No. 3 jersey. A two-time WNBA champion and former MVP, Parker's impact on the franchise remains unforgettable.

The all-rounder took four wickets for Lucknow to stop the Hyderabad freight train on Thursday, March 27.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
